page.title: 18CHILDREN AND T.V.
page.content: We did a survey of children's T.V. viewing habits. We asked the 30 pupils in our class to record what programmes they watched during one week in January 1985. The least amount of time spent in front of the 'tele' was 5 hrs 30 mins. The most was 24 hrs! We worked out the average to be about 11 hrs. per week. The most popular programmes were drama series followed by the 'soap operas'. Every one had a colour T.V. at home, and half of the class had a set in their own bedroom. 27 out of the 30 had a video recorder and 14 had a micro computer in the house. Every household had a car, and just over half of them had 2 or more cars. One boy had 8 T.V.s, 5 cars, a caravan and 2 speedboats! When we asked about watching T.V. in the summer everyone said that they spent far more time on the beach now!
